print: Used to display text or values in the terminal.
for: A loop used to repeat a block of code.
if: A conditional statement that executes code if a condition is true.
else: Executes code when the if condition is false.
elif: Checks another condition if the previous one was false.
while: A loop that runs as long as a condition is true.
function: A reusable block of code that performs a specific task.
return: Sends a value back from a function.
variable: A named container used to store data.
constant: A value that cannot be changed once defined.
boolean: A data type that can be either true or false.
string: A sequence of characters or text.
list: An ordered and mutable collection of items.
tuple: An ordered and immutable collection of items.
object: A collection of related data and methods.
class: A blueprint used to create objects.
method: A function that belongs to an object or class.
loop: A structure that repeats a block of code.
framework: A structured platform used to build applications.
api: A set of rules allowing software to communicate.
parameter: A variable used in a function definition.
argument: A value passed to a function.
scope: The area where a variable is accessible.
global: A variable accessible everywhere in the program.
local: A variable accessible only within a block or function.
syntax: The rules that define correct code structure.
runtime: The period when a program is running.
compile: The process of converting code into executable form.
debug: The process of finding and fixing errors.
error: A problem that prevents code from running correctly.
exception: An error that occurs during execution.
try: A block of code that may cause an error.
catch: Handles errors that occur in try blocks.
undefined: A variable that has not been assigned a value.
operator: A symbol used to perform operations.
comparison: Checks the relationship between two values.
logical operator: Used to combine or invert conditions.
assignment: Gives a value to a variable.
event: An action detected by a program.
callback: A function passed as an argument to another function.
promise: Represents a value that will be available later.
await: Waits for an asynchronous operation to complete.
process: A running instance of a program.
frontend: The user-facing part of an application.
backend: The server-side logic of an application.
query: A request for data from a database.
sql: A language used to manage databases.
xml: A markup language for storing data.
html: The language used to structure web pages.
css: The language used to style web pages.
javascript: A programming language for web interactivity.
python: A high-level programming language known for simplicity.
compiler: A program that translates source code into machine code.
version control: A system used to track code changes.
commit: A saved change in version control.
branch: A parallel version of a codebase.
open source: Software with publicly available source code.
